results.title: Twenty men and a leader
results.creator_credit: BFI, Gaumont-British Instructional and Donald Carter
results.brief_description: A spare-time class of recreative gymnastics: corrective exercises, vaulting, hurdling, cartwheels, obsticle races and various other team games and competitions are included in this demonstration of basic physical culture.

results.title: Twenty-four hours in Czechoslovakia
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Walford Hewitson and David Bairstow
results.brief_description: Hockey star Stan Mikita of the Chicago Black Hawks visits his native Czechoslovakia for a family reunion. During the course of a day and an evening the film accompanies him, his Chicago-born wife, and their daughter to places familiar to him in Prague and in the little village of Sokolce where he was born. There are many glimpses of the life of the Czech people at work, at home and at leisure. Their enthusiasm for hockey is evident throughout the film, especially when Mikita works out with a Czech team.

results.title: Twenty-four caprices. Opus 1 for solo violin - Nicolo Paganini (1782-1840)
results.brief_description: Considered the greatest interpreter of the works of Niccolo Paganini, violinist Ruggiero Ricci, on 10 January 1987, became the first violinist to record on video tape, Paganini’s “Twenty-four caprices” in one complete program. This is an unedited tape of that performance.

Episode of Series “World in action”.
Twenty eight up continues the World in action series, following the development and changing attitudes of a group of British children every seven years, they are now twenty eight. This program talks to Tony, Bruce and Suzi.

results.title: Twentieth century slavery
results.creator_credit: Unesco, National Educational Television and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: An examination of the policy of apartheid and the history of white domination in South Africa. While the native population maintains the country’s booming economy by providing a cheap labour force, the white population exercise strict control over every facet of native life and have created what is virtually a slave population.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Unesco, National Educational Television and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Twentieth Century Masters
results.creator_credit: Australian National Gallery, Peter Isaac and Terence Meast
results.brief_description: The Twentieth Century Masters video features a selection from the 71 works exhibited in the Twentieth Century Masters exhibition at the Australian National Gallery, Canberra and the Queensland Art Gallery, in 1986. Shot at the Australian National Gallery this video includes a number of works in the gallery’s permanent collection by artists represented in the exhibition. School of Paris artists discussed on the video tape include: Picasso, Matisse, Bonnard, Derain, Chagall, Soutine and Modigliani. Other European artists considered are Paul Klee and Max Beckmann.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Gallery, Peter Isaac and Terence Meast

results.title: Twentieth century focus: health hazards. Part 3. Drugs
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Gordon Croton
results.brief_description: Attempts to present a factual picture of drug-taking in Britain today. It deals with the extent of addiction, the social and medical effects, the legal situation, examines attempts being made to confront the problem.
